18.heading: Lois.
18.title: "If You're Old Enough to Do Something Like That, He Certainly Is!"
18.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
notes: Summary: Pam objects to Lois spending the night in her dad's apartment. Her husband is wearing a Kent State shirt.

19.heading: Lois.
19.title: "Uh, Lois, I Think It's Time We Had a Little Talk"
19.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: Lois has a graveyard with headstones for her fern, cactus, violet, hosta and geranium plants.

20.heading: Lois.
20.title: "Buyer's Remorse"
20.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Summary: Lois has voted, Sparrow and Ginger have closed on their house, and there's a pile of sawdust under the window.

21.heading: Lois.
21.title: "Famous Last Words"
21.author: Alison Bechdel
21.appears_in: p. 74-75 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger has indulged in flirtatious behavior at the national lesbian conference, and says it's nothing; then Malika sends her roses. The cigar-smoking, anchor-tatooed delivery man says, "A Ginger Jordan live here, Sonny?" To which Lois replies, "Yes, she does! Thank you kindly, Ma'm!"

22.heading: Lois.
22.title: "The Iceman Cometh"
22.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Summary: There's a storm, but Ginger makes it home safe. Sparrow has a date with a man (Stuart), whose car hits a phone pole and he arrives on foot and frozen. Lois promises not to carve a cucumber with a cleaver, and in fact gets ready to set up the Parcheesi board.

23.heading: Lois.
23.title: "Ill Humor"
23.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Published June 1996 in Between the Lines.

Summary: Hard times. Madwimmin is having to raise the deductible on their health insurance, Lois wants to add sex toys to the bookstore inventory, Sparrow comes home talking about people living on pancakes and surplus cheese and Mo and Lois decide they don't feel quite so bad.

24.heading: Lois.
24.title: "Support Group"
24.author: Alison Bechdel
24.appears_in: p. 78-89 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger struggles over interpreting and responding to the note that came with Malika's roses, while Lois and Sparrow offer a little too much help.

25.heading: Lois.
25.title: "Wing Ding"
25.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Published June 1996 in Between the Lines.
Summary: Mo comes to a potluck with Lois and Ginger, not knowing that Sydney will be there; Sydney brings fried chicken and Mo gives her an "impassioned vegetarian diatribe."
